column4: I've killed gdm and opened another terminal screen to edit xorg.conf
check to see if you are using the nvidia driver, not the nv driver
okay...are you running any desktop effects?
okay, what nvidia card do you have?
give me a second to check your model...you may need a different nvidia driver
I'm not sure...that's why I'm checking...please be patient.
I can't seem to find the list I used to have of which cards should get which driver... give me the output of
okay, give me a minute...I'm going to try to find that list one more time...
I still can't find that list :( but can I assume you can survive in a terminal (just in case you need to reset to the nv driver if one of the suggestions doesn't work)
okay, I'm not saying you should switch back, just if it doesn't work.
and you can't get into the gui
yeah, okay. I just wanted to make sure you wouldn't get lost if you had to use a terminal to recover
I remember there was a kernel module problem when doing this...so give me another minute to check how I circumvented that.
okay, so you need to install nvidia-glx-new
that might fix it. But...if you get an X error about a version mismatch or something to that effect...
you will need to reinstall nvidia-kernel-common and linux-restricted-modules-386 . That should do it...Good Luck
